content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #77175 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
I'm thinking P-medium; this issue seems to exist as far back as the beginning of 2017.
Oops, actually as far back as November 2019 (when async/.await was stabilized). But either way, it's been a while that this issue has existed.
I'd say P-low since it's only a lint
Agree with P-low as it's also an allow-by-default
hmm, I still think that incorrectly linting is P-medium as P-low is pretty much "we won't spend any effort into looking to fix this" afaik.
i agree with lcnr here, p-medium seems a better option
hm fair enough, I don't have a strong opinion then
Also it seems there's the potential something weird is going on somewhere that's not related to the lint

Camelid said:

Also it seems there's the potential something weird is going on somewhere that's not related to the lint

Just thinking aloud: would it make sense for this issue to be raised to a P-high and briefly mentioned during the meeting and then can perhaps relower it to P-medium? Is there anything than can help giving some context? Maybe a past similar issue?
I would rather add I-nominate than raise the priority just to get it discussed

Joshua Nelson said:

I would rather add I-nominate than raise the priority just to get it discussed

right, that's a better tool :thumbs_up: (in case we agree to submit the issue during the meeting)
